review: I would have liked to keep this device except for one major thing: Amazon Fire tV does not support Dramafever! That happened to be the one channel that my wife loved and watched the most, so I had to order a Roku 3 for her. I could stream it from her iPad via Airplay, but that seemed to defeat the purpose of having this super media streamer. I struggled a little bit on deciding to return the Fire TV, even after getting a Roku 3, as I really like it.Everything else about Fire TV is what you would hope for in a media streamer. Easy set up, fast and powerful, voice search, games..Nice, compact foot print and well desgined remote. The one thing that most others do not have (except Apple TV)  is optical audio output. Streaming HD movies from Netflix and Amazon Prime is a whole new experience, no hick-ups, almost no buffering what so ever. I have not had a downgrade to standard definition even once the whole time I used this device.If not having Dramafever is fine with you (I guess that is true for 99.999% of population), then by all means the Fire TV should be on the top of your list, when buying media streamers.

review: I love it! This is the first item like this that I've purchased and it was very easy to set up and use. I'm really happy to learn that by the end of the year we can get hbo go on it too.
